device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table)
scale: Near, personal space; Social space; Room
evaluation: Quality measurements (e.g., accuracy of tracking); Technical performance (speed); User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment)
contribution_desc: Tracking approach for determining device connectivity/pointing by using the doppler effect to enable multi-device interaction applications.The system is using the integrated audio hardware of mobile devices to determine into which direction a user is performing a pointing, flick or push gesture.
tracking_characteristic: Inside-out tracking; Multiple screens; Relative location
interaction_techniques: Only implicit, for use with the tracking technique, allows: point, flick and push gesture.
crossdevice_def: Multi-device interaction: "multiple smart computing devices in the environment - personal computers, smartphones, smart TVs, and other network-enabled devices (i.e., the smart home)"
